medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute pancreatitis with symptoms resembling coffee ground emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one day prior to admission with emesis resembling coffee grounds. The patient was initially hypoxic and unable to tolerate BiPAP. On arrival, the patient was hypotensive with a blood pressure of 67/46 and was subsequently intubated. Despite treatment, the patient remained hypoxic.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Seizure disorder, history of strokes, history of anoxic brain injury, bipolar disorder.
